items.stem: What does the passage mainly discuss?
options: The roles of state and federal governments in the economy of the nineteenth century
The participation of state governments in railroad, canal, and turnpike construction

items.stem: The word "effect" in paragraph (A) is closest in meaning to?
All of the following are mentioned in the passage as areas that involved state governments in the nineteenth century EXCEPT?
The word "distinct" in paragraph (A) is closest in meaning to?
It can be inferred from the first paragraph that in the nineteenth century canals and railroads were _____.
options: much more expensive to build than they had been previously
sometimes built in part by state companies
built with money that came from the federal government
built predominantly in the western part of the country

items.stem: The regulatory activities of state governments included all of the following EXCEPT?
The word "setting" in paragraph (B) is closest in meaning to?
The word "ends" in paragraph (C) is closest in meaning to?
According to the passage, which of the following is true of the Homestead Act of 1862?
options: It was a law first passed by state governments in the West.
It established tariffs in a number of regions.
It granted settlers easier access to land ownership in the West.
It increased the money supply in the West.

items.stem: Which of the following activities was the responsibility of the federal government in the nineteenth century?
options: Determining the conditions under which individuals worked
Regulation of the supply of money
Control of the manufacture of gunpowder
